data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After facing forward, you begin to take backward steps. There is no forward step. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right after taking 4 steps and turning around.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 10 steps before you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 7 steps requires returning to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 10 steps towards left, and take 9 steps towards the top right corner, you can turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You come to the same starting point if you're turning from left to right. The starting point is your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. The first 3 items are from the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 6 steps and turn around, you will take 8 steps to get back to your starting point. If you take 2 steps and turn around, you will take 2 steps to return to your starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Every step backward is an extra step taken forward. There are 4 steps forward, hence 6 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 9 steps to go back to the starting point. The instructions take in total 3 steps plus 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, then you should always take one step backward. If you always face forward, then you should always take one step backward. If you always face backward, then you should always take a step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always assume forward position. Forward position is always facing forward. You take 6 steps backward. Yes. The starting point would be facing forward. No. The starting point is left. Yes. To take one step backward you must take one step forward. Yes. To take 5 steps left you must take five steps left. Yes. To take 2 steps left you must take 2 steps left. Yes. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instructions, start from the starting position and complete all steps. If you exit your sequence you only take 9 steps left. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To put it another way, if taking 4 steps outward, 1 extra step inward is required to return back to the starting point. The directions say to always face forward and it is a recitation. So, I think the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps backwards and then forward. Take a step forward and then backward. Take one step forward with your opposite foot and take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you try to return to the starting point, you go through each sequence on the left side. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around is the first step in the sequence. If you turn around to take 3 steps first, you then take 6 steps. The second step is turn around to take 9. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first simplest route is to take 7 steps back to the original path. The second simplest route is to take 9 steps back to the original path. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since turn around means it back to starting point, then you must take 1 step to turn around. There are 9 steps in the 8 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person would go to a starting point if you take one step. The starting point is the point at which one starts. The ending is the number of steps that one takes in order to get to the other point. A person would return to a starting point if you take 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and start from the front and turn left. Take 1 step, take 3 steps and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If the first guide you were given asks you to take an extra 5 steps, take 5 steps. If the second guide you were given wants you to take an extra 2 steps, take 2 steps. If the third guide you were given asks you to take an extra 3 steps, take 3 steps or take 3 steps. If the fourth guide you were given asks you to take an extra 2 steps and turn around, take 2 steps. If you follow the instructions correctly, if you take the extra 3 steps on the third guide, you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around you have taken 7 steps; if you took 3 steps you would have gone 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only take 4 steps backwards in 8 steps. You can only take 7 steps forward in 8 steps. You cannot take 7 steps left in 4 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Face forward. A person never faces left. Forward facing. A person would not take 9 steps left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around, take 4 steps, return to starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is a set of instructions to a different point in time. It doesn't matter which way you go first. You continue to facing forward with your feet pointed forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right rewinds time. If you take 5 steps, it's rewind speed. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. The first three steps of the above instructions take you forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go back to starting point, you take 4 steps - 1 step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is the opposite direction of turn around given the first instructions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Usually facing forward you can only return to the starting point because facing forward is the original direction. Walking backwards from the original direction you will be in a forward motion. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Since the instructions are for one person, you may take 7 steps from one place to another and take 1 step from a different place to a different place. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can always take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps away is to do away with a complete face forward. Taking 9 steps forward is to get back on track. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you keep your back straight until you come to a slant. After you take the step backward you turn so you are facing forward. You take the steps and the starting point and then turn and begin taking the steps you had taken before. Taking steps left is the same as taking 6 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Once you have walked the complete route backwards, you can never take the same path forwards again. So, the answer is no.

You can turn around and return to the starting point once you have gained 2 steps. So, the answer is no.

If you make one step backward, then you will be facing forward. Once you make one step backward, you will take 4 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps backward. 5 steps backward. 4 steps backward. 8 steps backward. 3 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

When facing forward, one must always be facing forward. When facing backward they have to take 2 or 4 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Place of start is the 1st step which is 100 yards from start. Turn around which is around 100 ft from start to finish. 10 steps = 10 steps, 10 steps = 25 minutes or 50 minutes to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you're facing up and are facing left, you will take 4 steps. If you're facing down and are facing right, you will take 8 steps. The first three steps are all taken in the same sequence: 7 steps left then 8 steps right then 10 steps backwards and 4 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing backward, you always face forward. If you are facing right, you never face forward. There are always a few steps back in 1 minute. If you were to reverse the pattern, 9 steps - 5 steps right = 8 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps right. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Face forward takes 10 steps. If you always face forward, you'll always be in front. If you always face left, you'll always be behind. If you always face right, you'll always be at the top. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you take 5 steps backward. If you always face forward, you take 4 steps left. Thus, the answer is no.

The first step is always left. The other three steps take you backward. So, the answer is yes.

The right-most steps you'll take may not return you right-most. If you go right, you take 10 right-most steps. If you go left-most, you take 4 forward-most steps. These steps are equal to 100-95! = 0. So, the answer is Yes.
